messages.content: ComfyUI-depth-fm is a custom node in ComfyUI that uses the depth-fm monocular depth estimation model to generate depth maps from images.

You can install ComfyUI-depth-fm either by using the ComfyUI-Manager or by cloning the repo to custom_nodes and running 'pip install -r requirements.txt' or 'python_embeded\python.exe -m pip install -r ComfyUI\custom_nodes\ComfyUI-depth-fm\requirements.txt' if using portable.
Where can I find the pruned models for ComfyUI-depth-fm?

The pruned models for ComfyUI-depth-fm are available in the ComfyUI-Manager or from https://huggingface.co/Kijai/depth-fm-pruned/tree/main. They should be placed in the 'ComfyUI/models/checkpoints' directory.
What VAEs are compatible with ComfyUI-depth-fm?
Any SD1.5/2.1 VAE should work with the ComfyUI-depth-fm node.
What is the original model used in ComfyUI-depth-fm?
The original model used in ComfyUI-depth-fm is from https://ommer-lab.com/files/depthfm/depthfm-v1.ckpt.
What is the purpose of DepthFM?

DepthFM is a state-of-the-art, versatile, and fast monocular depth estimation model that can synthesize realistic depth maps within a single inference step. It also demonstrates capabilities in downstream tasks such as depth inpainting and depth conditional synthesis.
How does DepthFM compare to other depth estimators?
Despite being more efficient, DepthFM outperforms the current state-of-the-art generative depth estimator Marigold zero-shot on a range of benchmark datasets.
